guardians.controllers

Class ScheduleController

  • java.lang.Object
    • guardians.controllers.ScheduleController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/guardians/calendars")
public class ScheduleController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will handle requests related to Schedules and Schedule.ScheduleStatus
    Author:
    miggoncan

    • Method Detail

      • getSchedule

        private Schedule getSchedule(java.time.YearMonth yearMonth)
        This method will return a Schedule for the given YearMonth if the corresponding Calendar exists
        Parameters:
        yearMonth - The year and month for which the Schedule is to be found
        Returns:
        The found Schedule
        Throws:
        ScheduleNotFoundException - if the corresponding Calendar is not found
        See Also:
        ScheduleNotFoundException

      • getScheduleRequest

        @GetMapping(value="/{yearMonth}/schedule")
public org.springframework.hateoas.EntityModel<Schedule> getScheduleRequest(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                       java.time.YearMonth yearMonth)
        This method handles GET requests of a specific Schedule
        Parameters:
        yearMonth - The year and month of this schedule. E.g. 2020-06
        Returns:
        The found Schedule
        Throws:
        ScheduleNotFoundException - if the Schedule has not been generated yet

      • generateSchedule

        @PostMapping(value="/{yearMonth}/schedule")
 @ResponseStatus(value=NO_CONTENT)
public void generateSchedule(@PathVariable
                                                                                                            java.time.YearMonth yearMonth)
        This class handles POST requests used to generate a Schedule
        Parameters:
        yearMonth - The year and month for which the Schedule should be generated
        Throws:
        CalendarNotFoundException - if the Calendar of yearMonth does not exist
        ScheduleAlreadyExistsException - if the Schedule of this yearMonth has already being generated

      • updateSchedule

        @PutMapping(value="/{yearMonth}/schedule")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.hateoas.EntityModel<Schedule>> updateSchedule(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                            java.time.YearMonth yearMonth,
                                                                                                                                                            @RequestBody @Valid
                                                                                                                                                            @Valid Schedule schedule)
        This method will handle requests to update a Schedule
        Parameters:
        yearMonth - the year and month for which the Schedule should be updated
        schedule - The new value to use for the Schedule
        Returns:
        The persisted Schedule
        Throws:
        ScheduleNotFoundException
        javax.validation.ConstraintViolationException - if any of the ScheduleDays is not valid

      • changeStatus

        @PutMapping(value="/{yearMonth}/schedule/{status}")
public org.springframework.hateoas.EntityModel<Schedule> changeStatus(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                          java.time.YearMonth yearMonth,
                                                                                                                          @PathVariable
                                                                                                                          java.lang.String status)
        This method will handle requests to change the Schedule.ScheduleStatus of a Schedule Note not all transitions are allowed. For example, if a Schedule has already being Schedule.ScheduleStatus.CONFIRMED, it cannot be change back to Schedule.ScheduleStatus.NOT_CREATED
        Parameters:
        yearMonth - the year and month of the Schedule whose status is to be updated
        status - The new status of the Schedule
        Returns:
        The persisted Schedule with its new status
        Throws:
        ScheduleNotFoundException - if the schedule does not already exist
        InvalidScheduleStatusException - if the provided status is not valid, or the Schedule cannot be change from its current status to the given one

      • deleteSchedule

        @DeleteMapping(value="/{yearMonth}/schedule")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteSchedule(@PathVariable
                                                                                                               java.time.YearMonth yearMonth)
        This method will handle requests to DELETE a specific Schedule Note the Schedule cannot be already Schedule.ScheduleStatus.CONFIRMED This method is useful to regenerate a Schedule.
        Parameters:
        yearMonth - the year and month for which the Schedule should be deleted
        Throws:
        ScheduleNotFoundException
